cited_protocols.title: XTT Assay for Detection of Bacterial Metabolic Activity in water-based Polyester Polyurethane
XTT Assay for Detection of Bacterial Metabolic Activity in water-based Polyester Polyurethane

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4nrul","text":"In microbial biodegradation assays, the detection of bacterial growth in water-based plastic dispersions can be difficult to measure using traditional methods because of the turbidity of culture media and the formation of flocculi. Here, we present a protocol for the detection of bacterial growth in Impranil®DLN, a polyester polyurethane (PU) water-based dispersion. By measuring bacterial metabolic activity, as an indicator of cell viability with the water-soluble 2, 3-bis [2-methyloxy-4-nitro-5-sulfophenyl]-2H-tetrazolium-5-carboxanilide (XTT) salt. Viable growing cells, i.e., those cells that can utilize PU as a carbon source, will reduce the yellow-colored XTT to a water-soluble orange formazan by the action of dehydrogenase enzymes of the respiratory chain. For the standardization of the protocol, we used Pseudomonas putida KT2440 and Escherichia coli BL21 strains as positive and negative controls, respectively.  We determined the metabolic activity of the strains grown with citrate or both citrate and impranil as carbon sources. P. putida KT2440 showed higher XTT-detected metabolic activity in the presence of PU than when it was grown only with citrate, indicating that the strain also used PU as a carbon source. In contrast, the negative control did not show differences in metabolic activity between the growth conditions. Our protocol can be adapted to different bacterial strains and culture media.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":821,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":851,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Study of plastic biodegradation by marine bacteria from the Gulf of Mexico

g•L-1) (BM-PY broth) with an aliquot of the previous culture to obtain an OD600  of approximately steps.section: Detection of Bacterial Growth in Polyester Polyurethane
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mkga","text":"To evaluate microbial growth, measure the absorbance of each treatment every hour with an automated microplate spectrophotometer at Absmax (range of 450nm - 500nm) with a reference wavelength of 630nm immediately after the addition of XTT and again every hour. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":135,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfkvf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f2g08","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pa53","text":"Culture media:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hlhv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"febih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31g8j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1ajp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93dim","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aplr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ano95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0u8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":183,"style":"italic"},{"length":2,"offset":183,"style":"sub"}],"key":"7mep6","text":"The use of a reference wavelength considerably reduces the noise of the particles in the medium (background subtraction at 630–690 nm). Also, subtract the absorbance at time zero (Absi ) from subsequent readings to obtain the change in absorbance.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9prri","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":16,"style":"sub"},{"length":3,"offset":25,"style":"sub"},{"length":1,"offset":35,"style":"sub"},{"length":1,"offset":35,"style":"italic"}],"key":"66oe3","text":"Absorbance= [Absmax - Abs630] - Absi","type":"align-center"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,"114.00000762939453"],"data":[["","Abiotic control","Pos. control","Neg. control","Test microorganism"],["BM","x","x","x","x"],["BM-citrate","x","x","x","x"],["BM-citrate-Impranil","x","x","x","x"]],"guid":"D2F036A0D89811ED8D81C9B83704C166","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dt0j1","text":"\"x\" indicates that must be included.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["","Abiotic control","Pos. control","Neg. control","Test microorganism"],["BM","x","x","x","x"],["BM-citrate","x","x","x","x"],["BM-citrate-Impranil","x","x","x","x"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6688a","text":"Note that BM in positive control, negative control, and test microorganism correspond to biotic controls without any carbon source.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm67l","text":"Wash twice the cellular pellet by suspension in   of sterile 10mM  MgSO4 followed by centrifugation at   to remove all traces of the old culture medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":71,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":103,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"90EF157BD89C11ED928A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","centrifuge":"6000","duration":600,"error":false,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"90EF1664D89C11ED928A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6v4s6","text":"Measure the optical density (OD) at 600 nm of cultures using a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ve19","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a48f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"k73u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":54,"style":"sup"},{"length":3,"offset":98,"style":"sub"},{"length":3,"offset":109,"style":"sub"}],"key":"7v7se","text":"If needed, prepare a dilution of the culture (e.g., 10-1)  using fresh LB broth and measure its OD600. The OD600 of the original culture is calculated by multiplying the obtained OD by the dilution factor.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"f8ivt","text":"This procedure involves the use of hazardous chemicals (chloroform and methanol) for the glassware preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":111}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35ccg","text":"XTT contains no substances with occupational exposure limit values.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mbc4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3enh2","text":"Read the corresponding safety data sheets for each chemical in the procedure.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k4ao","text":"Use personal protective equipment throughout the procedure: nitrile gloves, wear a lab coat and safety glasses.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avn95","text":"Dispose of all chemical waste in appropriately labeled containers.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64j7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctfba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
